title: Understanding the Function and Graph
text: $$f(-2)$$ is the value of f(x) when $$x=-2$$. Locate $$x=-2$$ on the graph and observe the value of f(x). Closed circles are used for numbers that are less than or equal to and greater than or equal to $$( \leq $$ or $$ \geq )$$, meaning it is a value in the function.

title: Limit Value
text: Because there is an open circle at $$x=-2$$, this means that the function is undefined at that particular x-value. Since we are asked to find $$f(-2)$$, the value would be undefined. If we were asked to find limits, however, there is no difference with an open or closed circle because a limit is the value the graph is approaching from both the right and left sides.\n##figure2.gif##
